Title: Data Analyst, Trust and Safety, Ads
Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Kirkland, WA, USA; Austin, TX, USA.Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in data analytics, Trust and Safety, policy, cybersecurity, or related fields.


Preferred qualifications:


Experience with machine learning.
Experience in SQL, building dashboards, data collection/transformation, visualization/dashboards, or scripting/programming language (e.g., Python).
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence cross-functionally at various levels.
Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills with attention to detail in an ever-changing environment.


About The Job

Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

Our Trust and Safety team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, Google Ads and AdSense.

In this role, you will partner with the Engineering, Product, Legal, Policy and Scaled Operations team to drive operational performance and lower abuse rates. You will enable effectiveness and efficiency by driving strategic intent and execution excellence to deliver cross-functional initiatives at scale and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $108,000-$158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Responsibilities


Design and implement integrations between business objectives and business systems, including designing and building strategies that support these business systems.
Conduct strategic analysis, optimize business performance, and deliver within relevant product areas. This includes analyzing data, identifying trends, and developing solutions that improve business performance.
Manage projects involving multiple stakeholders, tight timelines, important organizational implications, and changing circumstances.
Use Google’s big data to conduct data-oriented analysis, architect metrics, synthesize information, solve problems, and influence business decision-making by presenting insights and market trends.
Perform on-call responsibilities on a rotating basis, including weekend coverage/holidays. Work with sensitive content or situations and be exposed to graphic, controversial, or upsetting topics or content.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Data Engineer Intern
Description:
Every month, billions of people leverage Meta products to connect with friends and loved ones from across the world. On the Data Engineering Team, our mission is to support these products both internally and externally by delivering the best data foundation that drives impact through informed decision making. As a highly collaborative organization, our data engineers work cross-functionally with software engineering, data science, and product management to optimize growth, strategy, and experience for over three billion users, as well as our internal employee community. In this role, you will see a direct correlation between your work, company growth, and user satisfaction. Beyond this, you will work with some of the brightest minds in the industry, and you'll have a unique opportunity to solve some of the most interesting data challenges with efficiency and integrity, at a scale few companies can match. As we continue to expand and create, we have a lot of exciting work ahead of us!

Data Engineer Intern Responsibilities:


Architect, implement and deploy new data models and data processes in production
Perform data analysis to generate business insights
Interface with Engineers, Product Managers and Data Scientists to understand product goals and data needs
Build data expertise and own data quality for allocated areas of ownership
Manage data warehouse plans for a product or a group of products
Support critical data processes running in production


Minimum Qualifications:


Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a Bachelors, or Masters degree in Computer Science, Information Science, Mathematics, or related technical field
Knowledge of SQL, data modeling and at least one programming language(e.g., Python, C++, C#, Scala)
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment


Preferred Qualifications:


Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship
Curious, self-driven, analytical and excited to play with data
Ability to thrive in a fast paced work environment
Experience in collaborating with individuals and organizations


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$6,120/month to $9,000/month + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Data Analyst III - Supply Chain Operations Planning
Description:
Job Description

The Data Analyst III will be a critical member of the Operations Planning team, owning variance analysis and the delivery of critical insights for Nordstrom’s Supply Chain Organization. The Data Analyst III will support volume forecast creation, data analysis, and dashboarding to enable efficient Supply Chain operations. This position will play a pivotal role in optimizing how JWN serves customers across all banners and channels.

Experience in demand, capacity, or labor planning in the retail environment is desired. Seeking candidates with a strong functional background and ability to define problem solving approaches in complex, data rich environments.

A day in the life…


Support SC Operations Planning team execute weekly and monthly planning cycles
Identify opportunities for systematic variance analysis and root cause identification
Lead ad hoc analysis to shape critical business decisions in fast moving environment
Champion the data needs of the SC Planning team and coordinate with key partners across the Nordstrom organization including Product Management, Data Science, Technology, Finance, and Merchandizing
Lead green-field analysis to explore and identify critical improvements to planning inputs or processes


You own this if you have…


Degree in Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, or related field preferred
Supply chain expertise in retail or consumer goods preferred; with exposure to logistics, fulfillment, returns, or supply chain planning
5+ years of data management and analysis
Knowledge of best practices for data consumption, aggregation & ingestion with leading visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Strong understanding of normalized data, de-normalized data, structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data
Strong understanding of data warehousing, query construction and dimensional data modeling with applied skills in SQL
Experience with Python and familiarity with data acquisition, analysis, modeling, and automation (e.g. Airflow).
Strong operational business understanding, including potential impact of business decisions on various internal/external stakeholders and systems
Comfort in presenting to business stakeholders and leadership


We’ve got you covered…

Our employees are our most important asset and that’s reflected in our benefits. Nordstrom is proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees and their families, including:


Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time Away
Life Insurance and Disability
Merchandise Discount and EAP Resources

Title: Product Data Analyst, Fraud
Description:
Job Description

Remitly’s vision is to transform lives with trusted financial services that transcend borders. Since 2011, we have been tirelessly delivering on our promises to people who send money around the world. Today, we are reimagining global financial services and building products that extend beyond traditional barriers to give customers access to more of the services they need, no matter where they call home. Join over 2,700 employees worldwide who are growing their careers with purpose and connection with our customers while having a positive impact on millions of people around the globe.

About The Role

The Product Analyst, Fraud will report to the Fraud Program Manager on Remitly’s User Integrity product squad. In this role, you will apply data science and analytics techniques to drive rapid, rational decision-making within one of Remitly’s new products. You'll build our ability to remove fraud risk from our platform through product solutions while streamlining the experience for good customers by partnering with program and product managers, engineers, analysts, and designers.

You Will


Become an expert on Remitly's fraud data, product experiences, policies, and systems
Build a unified understanding of how fraud data, customer experiences, and goals align
Develop data features and risk rules
Build and manage metrics used to evaluate fraud system performance and customer friction, and create monitoring measures to track them
Create hypotheses & design product experiments
Create agent-facing investigative tools to help improve performance and accuracy of our Fraud Specialists
Produce insights and help define longer term product strategies and roadmaps
Implement product strategy


You Have


3+ years in a product analyst role or similar full-time, professional experience.
Bachelor's degree in mathematics, engineering, economics, or another quantitative field (or equivalent additional experience).
Intermediate SQL Proficiency (Python, R, and modeling a bonus).
Working knowledge of foundational statistical concepts and how they can be applied in real world situations.
Experience distilling business problems, developing hypotheses, building an analytical framework, carrying out an analysis, and writing a clear recommendation.
Strong data communication skills, including data visualization, technical writing, and business writing.


Compensation Details. The starting base salary range for this position is typically $112,000 -$140,000. In the U.S., Remitly employees are shareholders in our Company and equity is part of our total compensation plan. Your recruiter can share more information about medical benefits offered, as well as other financial benefits and total compensation components offered with this role.

Our Benefits


Flexible paid time off
Health, dental, and vision + 401k plan with company matching
Paid parental, medical, military and family care leave
Mental Health & Family Forming Benefits
Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
Continuing education and travel benefits


We are committed to nondiscrimination across our global organization and in all of our business operations. Employment is determined based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without discrimination on the basis of race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender identification and expression, marital status, military status or status as an honorably discharge/veteran, pregnancy (including a woman’s potential to get pregnant, pregnancy-related conditions, and childbearing), sexual orientation, age (40 and over), national origin, ancestry, citizenship or immigration status, physical, mental, or sensory disability (including the use of a trained dog guide or service animal), HIV/AIDS or hepatitis C status, genetic information, status as an actual or perceived victim of domestic violence, sexual assault, or stalking, or any other protected class as established by law.

Remitly is an E-Verify Employer

Remitly is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Data Science Internship (Remote Eligible) - Graduate Student Preferred
Description:
This role is eligible to be performed remotely, however, if you reside within 60 miles of Lands' End's offices in Dodgeville, WI or New York, NY, you will be expected to collaborate onsite in a hybrid fashion for up to 12 days per month.


At Lands' End, we are on a mission to create a more comfortable world. We care about our employees, our community and our planet. People are the heart of our company, and our doors are open to everyone. We are committed to creating a welcoming, safe and inclusive environment for all. Our strength in work and life comes from the combination of our experiences, backgrounds and talents. It's what we do as people that makes Lands' End a great place to work.

As An Intern, You Will Join Over 5,000 Talented Individuals Who Are Leaders, Critical Thinkers, Accountable, Curious, Flexible And Results-minded All Driving Toward The Same Goal - To Delight Customers And Drive Sales Through Multiple Channels. In Addition, You Will Join a Diverse Group Of Individuals From a Variety Of Colleges, Universities And Areas Of Study. Some Highlights Of Our Internship Program Include


Paid Internship: $25/hr (graduate-level hourly rate)
Twelve-week program: May 19 - August 8, 2025
Full-time opportunity: 8am - 5pm CT
Summer Hours: Work ends on Fridays at 1pm CT
Team building and networking activities
Group projects and career-building workshops
Leadership and cross-functional learning opportunities
Assigned mentor focused on your growth and development
Senior leader speaker series
Lands' End merchandise discount


Our internship program is designed with future leaders in mind and serves as a pipeline for top talent. Participants in our program receive one-on-one mentorship while working alongside seasoned Data Analytics professionals. You will work with the team to develop and provide analysis and identify opportunities for innovation, efficiency and productivity. We will look to you to share your ideas and recommendations. The Intern experience at Lands' End is a comprehensive development-based role, designed to facilitate a robust Data Analytics career path. Interns will be immersed and integrated in the various functions of Data Analytics and understand the factors that contribute to the broader scope of Data Analytics while gaining valuable hands-on experience in skill competency areas.

Responsibilities

Title: Data Analyst Lead
Description:
Our client is seeking a full-time analyst for a senior position on our strong and dynamic team. They have value-based care contracts with multiple payers; this position performs analytics and data management functions supporting population health for providers in those contracts, as well as all populations in the network. Experience in analytics using payer claims and eligibility data combined with EMR clinical data is valuable in this role.




Length: 6-month contract-to-hire

Associate Vendors: We are accepting applications from candidates who are currently authorized to work in the US for any employer without sponsorship.




Role & Responsibilities

Lead cross-functional teams of developers, analysts, scientists, clinicians, and business owners in a team-driven, agile environment to develop and scale analytic results and products.
Work alongside clinicians to develop solutions to solve critical health care needs, and provide input into driving business and clinical operations and quality improvement with analytics.
Dive deep into multiple data streams to find sources for analytic tools.
Provide the primary conduit between analytics and the business for a given delivery area, and support the development of analysts on the team.




Required Qualifications:

7+ years of experience in data analysis and bachelor’s degree in an IT Field, or 11+ years of experience in data analysis with no bachelor’s degree.
Expert knowledge of data analysis and display techniques.
Experience with complete metrics solution development life-cycle, including requirements gathering, analysis and design, coding, testing and deployment.
Advanced experience in data extraction using SQL, R or python with the ability to mentor others (FOCUS ON SQL).
Advanced experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI).
Experience working with source control tools and version management, such as GIT.
Experience working within claims and insurance/payer data.
Prior experience in Healthcare setting.




Desired Qualifications:

Prior experience working at an insurance/payer company.
Experience with clinical, hospital and/or financial applications and/or systems
Experience in a lead position on a development team supporting integrated data solutions for a wide range of customer groups or three (3) years of experience in a senior data analyst role.
Uses reasonable and basic statistical analyses to make comparisons and detect trends, communicate insights.
Utilizes established data analysis models and tools for analyzing qualitative or quantitative data.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Celebrating 20 years of excellence, SkinSpirit is a top destination for aesthetic skincare and body—with over 45 locations nationwide. Our highly trained experts are the best in the industry—renowned for personalized service delivering safe, effective, medically-proven treatments and optimal results. SkinSpirit is here to ensure you find joy in your skincare journey and happiness in the results you’re looking for.

We thrive in a people-first culture with an authentic emphasis on wellbeing. As we grow, we reinforce the integrity of our unique culture by leading with love and an unparalleled passion for what we do. We offer world-class training and education. And as industry leaders we’re always innovating—bringing state-of-the-art equipment and services to our clinics. Join the SkinSpirit experience!

We offer a competitive benefits package which includes generous employee discounts, Friends & Family discounts and a beautiful working environment with a stellar team. We also offer paid holidays and a 401k plan with a company match program. For full-time employees we offer Medical, Vision, and Dental insurance.

Location:

This is a hybrid position. Candidate MUST be located in one of the following US states/areas: AZ, CA, CO, DC, FL, GA, MD, MN, NJ, NY, NC, NV, OR, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA. Candidate MUST be available to work PST business hours.

Position Overview

The Business Intelligence Analyst is a strategic thinker who will combine expertise in data analysis, data visualization, and business acumen to transform complex data sets into actionable insights. This role employs a variety of tools and methodologies to interpret trends, patterns, and predictions within business data, providing a foundation for improved efficiency, increased profitability, and competitive advantage. The role also involves extensive cross-functional collaboration with marketing, IT, Operations, and Finance. It also empowers stakeholders to make informed decisions that drive business success.

What You’ll Do


Oversee the end-to-end development and support of SkinSpirit’s Business Intelligence reporting environments and data warehouse, including Snowflake, Power BI, Power App, Power Automate, Rivery, and other technologies as needed
Provide data management services such as accessing new data feeds, building queries and macros, organizing data and designing dashboards that present status-at-a-glance visualization for business performance
Lead and partner with a variety of stakeholders across the organization to design, build and test new reports and analytics dashboards
Train end-users on new reports and dashboards, providing technical support as needed
Guide data strategy and the analytic needs of the business by aggregating data from diverse sources (e.g. EMR, Finance, Call Data, Marketing, HR, etc.) with incongruent data definitions and types
Partner with and oversee work performed by data engineering vendors on updates to existing integrations and dashboards, as well as the development of new data integrations and dashboards
Own the data integrity across multiple connected systems, including defining and communicating data definitions and monitoring metric consistency
Build and monitor analytics dashboards to identify and resolve data inaccuracies and performance issues. Make recommendations for system improvements to increase accuracy, reliability and accessibility
Use various project management methodologies, including Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)/Waterfall model and Agile, to successfully execute projects on time, budget and scope
Maintain robust documentation library including data dictionaries, architecture diagrams, development standards, standard operating procedures, disaster recovery/business continuity plans, etc.
Ensure full compliance with architectural and reporting standards, operating procedures, regulatory requirements, and data integrity levels
Conduct market analysis to benchmark the company’s business intelligence capabilities against others to identify new opportunities
Assist with other duties as assigned


What You’ll Bring


Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing, Business, Economics or equivalent experience in related field required
5+ years of relevant work experience building with data visualization using PowerBI, or similar tools
5+ years of experience with data modeling, warehousing, and building ETL pipelines using SQL for integrations. Snowflake, Rivery and Python experience preferred
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation
Experience working with and integrating data from API connections
Understands multi-tiered data warehouse structures
Excellent communication skills tying together technologies and architectures to business results and present to stakeholders at all levels
Strong problem-solving, critical thinking and decision-making skills
Excellent customer service skills that including listening to user groups and speaking with them at the appropriate level
Demonstrated ability to learn quickly, manage multiple projects, and adapt to changing priorities
Self-motivated and can manage working remotely
Proven history excelling in a fast-paced environment.
Proficiency in Microsoft Products and ability to quickly learn new technology platforms


Physical Requirements


Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer
Occasionally stand, walk, use hands and fingers, handle or feel, reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop, knee, crouch or crawl, talk and hear


Compensation Range: $100,000 - $130,000* (Plus bonus potential)


Compensation will be determined based on a candidate's skills, experience, location, etc.

Description:
Now Brewing – information security corrective action data analyst! #tobeapartner

 

From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only

celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. At Starbucks, our mission is to inspire and nurture the limitless possibilities of human connection – one person, one cup, and one neighborhood at a time. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. Starbucks technologists work to achieve this mission with innovative technology delivered to our partners, customers, stores, roasters, and global communities.

This position reports to the manager of Risk within the Starbucks Global Cybersecurity Services (GCS) organization. GCS is chartered with leading, inspiring, and supporting Starbucks to cultivate trust in our brand by ensuring confidentiality, integrity, & availability in every partner, customer & supplier experience.

As the corrective action data analyst, you will support the risk function and specifically the Corrective Action program within the Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) service portfolio. This data analyst will be responsible for collecting, aggregating, analyzing, and visually communicating the information to enable the triage and prioritization of risks through their lifecycle.

To be successful, the corrective action data analyst needs to have demonstrated passion for learning, willingness to dive into the details, a drive to improve existing ways of working, and a desire to delight with outstanding service.

As an information security corrective action data analyst, you will…


Support risk management processes to identify, triage, manage, report and drive technology identified corrective actions toward resolution.
Manage the team’s Corrective Action support queue, work to analyze risk, triage, and escalate to teammates according to priority and required expertise. The requires the initiative to gather information, convey accurate and timely status, and use GRC tools for reporting, data analysis, and troubleshooting.
Build procedural documentation (e.g., process flows, data flow maps, SOP's) or other work instructions to support the cybersecurity, risk program (e.g., Wiki, Knowledge Base Articles).
Drives continuous improvement of risk management and corrective action processes by participating in the scrum team (agile methodology) with the GRC risk team.
Be receptive and responsive to coaching and guidance from leaders and more experienced team members while seeking input and support, as required.


We’d love to Hear From People With


Experience in IT compliance (SOX, PCI, internal controls), IT risk management (NIST, ISO27001), Internal Audit or Data Privacy fields, or in a related area, 0-2+ years of relevant experience
Ability to apply knowledge of multidisciplinary business principles and practices to support successful outcomes in projects and activities.
Basic understanding of risk, controls and compliance and technology governance concepts.
Ability to use knowledge, sound judgment, and resourcefulness to support the design and deployment of global risk management processes.
Ability to balance multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
Certifications such as CISSP, CISA, CIPP, or others focused on information security, data privacy or information risk management is desired.
GRC/Cybersecurity Technology (Archer, ServiceNow, Brinqa) knowledge a plus
Strong written and verbal communication.

What’s more, Starbucks offers flexible scheduling and opportunities for paid time off. Visit starbucksbenefits.com for details.

If you live in the greater Seattle area, we offer a flexible workplace that allows for hybrid work. Partners can work remotely up to two days per week.

Join us and inspire with every cup. Apply today!

We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. Source data required to support data applications

Bachelor's degree or 2+ years of Data Analyst experience/related role.

Experience in building and supporting Power BI dashboards

GCS is chartered with leading, inspiring, and supporting Starbucks to cultivate trust in our brand by ensuring confidentiality, integrity, & availability in every partner, customer & supplier experience.

As the corrective action data analyst, you will support the risk function and specifically the Corrective Action program within the Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) service portfolio. This data analyst will be responsible for collecting, aggregating, analyzing, and visually communicating the information to enable the triage and prioritization of risks through their lifecycle.

To be successful, the corrective action data analyst needs to have demonstrated passion for learning, willingness to dive into the details, a drive to improve existing ways of working, and a desire to delight with outstanding service.

As an information security corrective action data analyst, you will…


Support risk management processes to identify, triage, manage, report and drive technology identified corrective actions toward resolution.
Manage the team’s Corrective Action support queue, work to analyze risk, triage, and escalate to teammates according to priority and required expertise. The requires the initiative to gather information, convey accurate and timely status, and use GRC tools for reporting, data analysis, and troubleshooting.
Build procedural documentation (e.g., process flows, data flow maps, SOP's) or other work instructions to support the cybersecurity, risk program (e.g., Wiki, Knowledge Base Articles).
Drives continuous improvement of risk management and corrective action processes by participating in the scrum team (agile methodology) with the GRC risk team.
Be receptive and responsive to coaching and guidance from leaders and more experienced team members while seeking input and support, as required.


We’d love to Hear From People With


Experience in IT compliance (SOX, PCI, internal controls), IT risk management (NIST, ISO27001), Internal Audit or Data Privacy fields, or in a related area, 0-2+ years of relevant experience
Ability to apply knowledge of multidisciplinary business principles and practices to support successful outcomes in projects and activities.
Basic understanding of risk, controls and compliance and technology governance concepts.
Ability to use knowledge, sound judgment, and resourcefulness to support the design and deployment of global risk management processes.
Ability to balance multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
Certifications such as CISSP, CISA, CIPP, or others focused on information security, data privacy or information risk management is desired.
GRC/Cybersecurity Technology (Archer, ServiceNow, Brinqa) knowledge a plus
Strong written and verbal communication.

Manage and drive effective email and call campaigns with the goal of gathering and verifying private market data
Consistently provide quality customer service, responding to requests from internal and external customers daily

Collaborate with other members of the Primary team and the broader Data Operations department to develop and improve processes, tools, and methodologies; identifying opportunities to improve upon the core quality metrics (comprehensiveness, accuracy, and timeliness)

Work closely with our Data Operations team in Mumbai to ensure we are accurately and comprehensively entering data into the PitchBook platform. This relationship includes auditing work for any issues that result from translation discrepancies as well as joining calls to share best practices and process improvement ideas
Communicate effectively and efficiently with your team and other stakeholders across the Data Operations department to provide updates on project progress, address roadblocks, and celebrate wins
Support the vision and values of the company by setting an example and demonstrating desired behaviors
Participate in various company initiatives and projects as requested



Skills and Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree required
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Enjoy relationship building and conversing with new people every day and comfortable to engage a diverse group of industry contacts
Ability to operate with a strong sense of urgency and deliver results
Self-motivated and goal-oriented attitude and can work effectively as an individual or as part of a team
Interest in financial markets or services, particularly private equity and venture capital
Possess terrific prioritization skills to handle a large volume of outbound calls on a daily basis
Analytical and process-oriented with a dedication to continuous improvement
Ability to problem solve and use judgment to make decisions when faced with ambiguous situations
Highly curious with a positive attitude
Strong organization skills with attention to detail
Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite including in-depth knowledge of Outlook, Word, and Excel with the ability to pick up new systems and software easily

Physical Health


Comprehensive health benefits
Additional medical wellness incentives
STD, LTD, AD&D, and life insurance



Emotional Health


Paid sabbatical program after four years
Paid family and paternity leave
Annual educational stipend
Ability to apply for tuition reimbursement
CFA exam stipend
Robust training programs on industry and soft skills
Employee assistance program

Social Health


Matching gifts program
Employee resource groups

Dependent Care FSA
Company-wide events
Employee referral bonus program
Quarterly team building events



Financial Health


401k match
Shared ownership employee stock program
Monthly transportation stipend
Please be aware the above PitchBook benefit and perk offerings are subject to corresponding plan and policy documents and may change during the course of your employment.

Target annual bonus percentage: 7.5%

Most roles work in the office 3+ days/week, and some are expected to work in the office 4-5 days/week. The current expectation for this role is that you are working in the office 3+ days/week and that you are in the office full-time during the training period, for which the length varies by role. Title: Data Center Energy Regulatory Analyst
Description:
Our data centers are the foundation upon which our rapidly scaling infrastructure efficiently operates to deliver our innovative services. Meta is seeking an experienced, organized and self-motivated individual to support the tracking, analysis, and engagement in electric utility regulatory proceedings in jurisdictions where Meta has existing data centers or is considering developing new data centers.In this role, you will be a key contributor to Meta’s energy team, specifically supporting Meta’s participation in regulatory dockets and utility stakeholder processes at state public utilities commissions or regional transmission organizations on issues related to reliability, interconnection process, energy rates, new tariffs, access for customers to secure clean and renewable energy, or long term utility resource planning. Your responsibilities will include: reviewing, monitoring, and tracking regulatory proceedings, evaluating and documenting impacts of various electric utility proposals on Meta’s operations, and supporting the development and mobilization of Meta’s external engagement strategies. In this role you will work closely with a cross functional team including members of Meta’s energy, legal, site development, and policy organizations.

Data Center Energy Regulatory Analyst Responsibilities:


Review, track, analyze, and summarize utility regulatory proceedings including general rate cases, changes in customer obligations to secure retail service agreements, utility resource planning and procurement, new tariff proposals, etc.
Support the development of Meta’s external engagement strategies, including potential participation in trade organizations or multi-company joint interventions.
Lead the initial review of regulatory proposals and evaluate the potential impacts of those proposals on Meta’s operations, data center development plans, and sustainability goals, and ensure consistent policy positions across the Meta fleet.
Build and maintain relationships with internal partners including energy managers, energy program managers, energy analysts, site selection, legal, policy, and other other departments.
Implement processes to optimize regulatory docket identification, tracking, and reporting.
Lead communication and deliverables between internal stakeholders and consultants.
Support the execution of overarching and site-specific energy infrastructure strategies for Meta’s data centers.
Support and participate in various ad-hoc energy initiatives for Meta and its energy program, driving successful outcomes and delivering value to the organization


Minimum Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in business, engineering, environmental, or other related discipline.
3+ years of work experience with an electric utility, state regulatory commission, regional transmission organization, financial institution, energy supplier, energy consultant, renewable energy project developer, or other related field.
Experience with utility regulatory proceedings and processes, regional transmission organizations, and energy market fundamentals and dynamics.
Experience analyzing and interpreting utility proposals, including rate or other tariff changes, green tariffs, and/or utility resource planning dockets.
Proven communication, organizational and program management skills, with the experience to manage multiple projects and coordinate with internal and external stakeholders.
Experience in building cross-functional relationships.
Experience with MS Office (Excel and PowerPoint) and G-Suite (Google Docs, Google Slides, Google Sheets).


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, provide digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to accomplish their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in accomplished people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data and improve. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland.

Job Description

What you will do:

You will provide data processing, services and solutions, within a data environment, to businesses with simple and complex needs. You will work for clients across many sectors including Banking, Energy and Telecommunications.


Engage with Account Managers and clients to ensure requirements and data deliveries are understood and fulfilled to expectations.
Demonstrate effective communication with internal and external stakeholders to ensure high quality deliveries to our clients
Run simple and complex batch processes to deliver data to clients.
Simple and complex coding to extract data from files to underpin data activities.
Involvement in delivery of high-quality work within agreed timescales, contributing to overall client project goals
Provision of counts and profile analysis to support campaign and strategic activity for clients
Manage creating, modifying and monitoring of automated processes for clients
Maintain the codebase and incorporate any new developments


You will report into the Senior Delivery Consultant.

Qualifications

What you will bring:


Experience of SQL
Demonstrate analytical thinking with experience solving numerical and data problem
Understanding of data, data structures and their value regarding use for data processing and data delivery
Experienced in building relationships with colleagues by email, phone, video conference and face-to-face meetings
Experience managing multiple tasks


Additional Information

Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & book.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.

Title: Data Analyst / Power BI
Description:
We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.




LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:

Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS

You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have an analytical mindset.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.




You get even more bonus points if …

You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER

We’re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …




Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

Title: Data Analyst – Business Intelligence
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our team and help drive business growth through data-driven insights. In this role, you will be responsible for preparing and analyzing data, creating visualizations, and telling compelling stories with data to support business decisions. You will be a member of Data Science and AI team of Care Chemicals Global Digitalization. We are looking for

candidates open to critical thinking and ideation thus formal background is not critical. This position will report to the Managing Director of Croatia and the Global Leader of Digitalization at Care Chemicals.




Contract type: external contract (leasing)




RESPOSNIBILITIES




Prepare and analyze business and chemical data to generate insights that support strategic decision making.
Build and maintain reports and dashboards using Power BI, ensuring they provide clear and actionable business insights.
Leverage low-code solutions to streamline data processes and support AI and automation efforts.
Translate complex data findings into easy-to-understand stories for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Collaborate with developers to ensure smooth integration of data science and AI solutions to support business initiatives.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs and tailor data analysis to meet business goals.




QUALIFICATIONS




Experience in data preparation, statistical data analysis, data storytelling
Proficiency in Power BI (or Tableau) for data visualization and reporting
Understanding of at least one programming language (Python preferred but not required).
Proficiency in written and spoken English, with the ability to communicate complex technical ideas clearly.
Ability to take proactive independent initiatives while collaborating with developers and business stakeholders.
Interest and familiarity with AI technology
University degree or equivalent experience in Data Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Chemistry with a focus on data analysis, or relevant fields.

Optional:

Experience with Power Apps and Power Automate
Knowledge of SQL and Big Data technologies, such as Databricks and PySpark.
Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodology




BENEFITS




Development discussions and programs so you can reach your full potential and develop yourself within the BASF family.
Flexible work arrangements and mobile working options so you can balance your working life and private life.
An attractive competitive salary that is based on the company's s success and your individual performance
An enriching environment that fosters the exchange of diverse engineering and scientific knowledge and collaboration among colleagues and teams.




ADVANTAGES OF DEVELOPING IT CAREER AT BASF




Joining our company means working with state-of-the-art equipment, software, and advanced technologies, such as generative AI, LLMs and Machine Learning
As BASF’s IT team member, your work will have a high-level impact on the business
With you, our local IT hub – created with the purpose of developing “in house” digital solutions – will get a new valuable member. By joining the hub, you are supporting us in making digitalization solutions for better business, for a better BASF.




At BASF, the chemistry is right. Because we are counting on innovative solutions, on agile working methods, on sustainable actions. And on you.

¿QUÉ BUSCAMOS?

Analista de Datos que impulse la capacidad analítica y de explotación de datos, con habilidades en análisis funcional, modelado de datos orientado al análisis y herramientas de visualización y procesamiento de datos.




Este rol será clave en la fase de explotación del proyecto, generando entendimiento/visión (insights) que apoyen la toma de decisiones..




¿QUÉ VOY A HACER?

Diseñar y ejecutar estrategias de análisis y visualización de datos que soporten la gestión y disponibilidad de activos dentro de la organización, trabajando estrechamente con los equipos Gobierno y Ágora para establecer métricas clave, colaborar en el diseño de modelos de datos, y en la normalización y calidad de los datos.




Se requerirá un enfoque proactivo para interpretar grandes volúmenes de información, estructurarla de manera accesible y generar reportes que aporten valor al negocio y faciliten la integración de los activos con otras unidades y aplicaciones.




¿QUÉ NECESITARÉ PARA ELLO?

Al menos 3 años de experiencia en perfiles de Data Analyst o similares. Con los siguientes conocimientos:




-Power BI:

Creación de dashboards avanzados, experiencia en la optimización y diseño de visualizaciones de datos y en la creación de métricas calculadas (DAX).

-Snowflake (o similar):

Capacidad para administrar y extraer datos en Snowflake, creando estructuras eficientes de datos que puedan escalar y optimizar el acceso a información en toda la empresa.

-SQL Avanzado:

Alta competencia en SQL, incluyendo la capacidad de optimizar consultas y administrar grandes volúmenes de datos.

-Lenguajes de Scripting Python o R:

Para procesamiento de datos, automatización de tareas de ETL y análisis estadístico.

-Tecnología de Almacenamiento de Datos

Competencia en el uso de herramientas de Data Warehousing y procesamiento de datos, especialmente Snowflake (o tecnologías similares como BigQuery o Redshift).
Experiencia en optimización de consultas SQL y en procesamiento de grandes volúmenes de datos.

-Análisis Funcional y Modelado de Dominios:

Habilidades para realizar un análisis funcional y mapear la estructura de datos participando en la definición de modelos específicos para reportes o análisis, identificando métricas y datos clave en relación con los objetivos de negocio.
UML, ERD, o técnicas de modelado de datos orientado a dominios.




PERKS (BENEFICIOS)

👨‍🎓 Acceso a formación continua: presupuesto individual para formación, obtención de certificaciones, acceso ilimitado a Udemy, clases de idiomas, dinámicas de formación interna.

🏠 Flexibilidad horaria, teletrabajo, posibilidad de trabajar desde nuestros Hubs.

📅 22 días de vacaciones + día de cumpleaños + 2 días de asistencia a eventos técnicos + 24 y 31 de diciembre no laborables.

🌞 Wellbeing pack: Ayuda para la mejora del bienestar.

💵 Retribución flexible.

🎉 Dinámicas y Eventos de Teambuilding

🎁 Pack de Bienvenida

💻 Posibilidad de elegir equipo (Windows / Mac)

🚀 Otras Iniciativas que te permiten conseguir bonus adicionales: recomendar profesionales, speaker en eventos, artículos técnicos,...




And last, but not least: ¡porque somos muy Sngulares!💙 Tenemos Encuentro Virtual todos los viernes, fiestas, espacios donde podrás expresarte, proponer cambios y ser partícipe de ellos.




SNGULAR está comprometida con la protección del Medio Ambiente, por lo que realizamos el proceso de selección de manera 100% digital, evitando así los desplazamientos y el uso de papel. Cuidamos los recursos ambientales y trabajamos para conseguir nuestros objetivos de sostenibilidad.

At Samsung we approach everything we do with the spirit of a ‘joyful pioneer’- daring to defy barriers and striving to excel limits. Samsung Electronics Romania is looking for a Marketing Analyst for the Digital, Strategy & Planning team.




The Marketing Analyst will be supporting the enhancement of the data collection, tracking and analytics capabilities of the Samsung marketing. The Marketing Analyst will be responsible for developing and implementing tracking and analytics plans, supporting with dashboards, reports and insights. Main internal stakeholders: wider marketing team (Category & Campaign, Digital, PR & Communication) and divisions. Markets to be covered: Romania and Bulgaria.

You will explore data to find trends and identify new opportunities for the organization. Also, you will help improve and automate current reporting activities.




Key Responsibilities

• You are organized, detailed oriented, flexible and possess ability to establish priorities with minimal guidance in a fast paced environment – be proactive, analytical problem solver and strategist, who is able to draw conclusions- not just report the data.

• Translate business requirements into meaningful set of reports, ad hoc analysis and new reporting solutions, and particularly related to marketing and sales activities

• Explore data to identify trends and anomalies, develop new analytical capabilities/solutions

• Transform and cleanse outputs from data warehouse into relevant analysis for business/sales teams

• Summaries analyses into PowerPoint presentations or formatted Excel reports

• Help explain analysis results to business team

• Automate and optimize current reports, will be owner for some specific audience dashboards to support the management.

• Collaborate to refine methodology and calculations




Skills and Qualifications




To be successful, you will possess the following skills and attributes:

• Proven experience using excel full time

• Extensive experience working in an agency or company leading media analytics

• Exposure to automation

• Experience working with large relational databases

• Demonstrated expertise in connecting various sources of data (across digital media channels or platforms) to create a holistic view of data

• Experience with statistical analysis/tools

• Familiarity with media, Digital / Mobile /TV KPI

• Strong written and verbal communication skills

• Experience with ad tech and digital media ops

• A high degree of analytical expertise is crucial, along with the ability to communicate test results in basic terms for consumption of non-technical colleagues.

• Willing to work closely with non-technical teams and learn new concepts

• Degree in computer science/engineering or quantitative discipline (Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics). Masters Preferred.

• Familiarity with Digital Marketing

• Proficient with Google Analytics

• Working knowledge of automation and CRM platforms

• Experience working with Domo, Tableau, and PowerBI

• Experience with AWS tools such as EC2 and S3.

• Jira, Confluence, GitHub and other agile development tool experience.

• Experience working with a DMP

• Experience with data visualization




What does success look like?




• A love for data and statistics, for example exploring data for fun, find patterns, create norms for marketing insights report results. You are curious and take initiatives on finding new insights, new angles are looking at the data and deep dive into the meanings of campaign insights results. Support the development of reporting capacities for all types of marketing activities.

• You have a passion to test and learn in a fast paced environment, your curiosity is outstanding.

• Help build a data-informed culture – provide decisions makers with the information they need when they need it and in a way they can trust and act on.

• Experience to develop strategic relationships with all areas of the business (sales, marketing, finance, business intelligence etc). You can root cause issues quickly and uncover core issues, then assist, collaborate with, and teach the teams how decisions affect efficiency, scalability, new mechanisms as they are needed.




Do you believe you have what it takes to become our new Marketing Analyst ? If so, we offer you a very stimulating job in an international and expansive company where your skills, ambitions and determination will decide your future. You will have the opportunity to work in an organization where the time from an idea to action is short.

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Reporting Analyst

Lisbon, Portugal




Kantar’s Worldpanel division is searching for creative entry-level Reporting Analyst. Based in Lisbon, Portugal this is an incredible opportunity to be part of our exciting vision for the future!




The Team and Role’s mission




Our Reporting team is largely focused on delivering data reports that are tailored and customized to our stakeholders’ needs – by extracting and combining data from multiple sources and internal databases and platforms, this team enables critical business decisions to be determined through a clear, understandable view of our data.

We’re currently looking for a committed Reporting Analyst to join our Reporting team! As a Reporting Analyst, you’ll be trained and encouraged to extract, process, and validate produced data, as well as deliver and produce Ad Hoc reports and translate our stakeholders’ requirements into reporting deliverables.

If you’re willing to go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary and join us!




Key outcomes




• Responsible for the preparation of end-client deliverables using both industry standard and Kantar-specific technology and tools.

• Extracting data using different platforms/tools.

• Processing and validation of produced data.

• Deliver and produce Ad Hoc and ongoing reports.

• Translate stakeholders’ requirements into reporting deliverables.

• Ensuring quality assurance and control of the produced reports.




Key Capabilities

Your background will ideally look like this…

• Knowledge or previous experience in data manipulation is appreciated.

• Be able to write, read, comprehend, reason, and perform basic mathematic calculations and data analysis.

• Knowledge or previous experience with MS Excel (e.g. Advanced Formulas; Pivot Tables) is recommended.

• English professional proficiency – minimum B2 Level is required.

With the following qualities…

• Inquisitive, with critical thinking, and demonstrate a genuine passion for consumer behavior.

• Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.

• Is proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.

• Is highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work effectively within different cultural and technical environments.

• Possesses outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in order to comfortably connect with partners at all levels across the organization and facilitates discussions in a constructive manner.




Join us!




At Kantar, we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based on a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and to support a pay-for-performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver. We also make sure we create an equality of opportunity in a fair and encouraging working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to thrive in a space where their mental health and well-being are taken into consideration.

Our dedication revolves around devising solutions that streamline the operations of commercial mobility companies, striving to simplify their everyday challenges.

Each entity contributes to our vision of democratizing the on-road mobility industry, with a focus on positive impacts on our industry, society, and the environment.

At Eurowag Group, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage women, men, and individuals of all backgrounds to apply and join our team.

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst skilled in creating data models to join our dynamic team. This role involves working with various data sources to develop effective data models that serve as the foundation for creating business reports.

Responsibilities:


Identify and analyse the data in source systems and integrate it into the data warehouse based on the reporting needs
Design and maintain the structure of the data model and ensure its documentation
Create a reporting layer from data warehouse tables for business users
Together with data engineering build robust and maintainable data pipelines.
Ensure that the data model is designed efficiently and in accordance with the requirements of the reporting tools
Participate in the analytical and reporting tasks to ensure that the data model is aligned with them
Collaborate and communicate with data and business analysts, developers and stakeholders to translate business requirements into efficient data structure
Help to increase the data quality, identify data issues and propose solutions


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, or a related field
At least 2 years of relevant experience in business intelligence, data analytics or data engineering
Solid understanding of data integration tools, ETL/ELT processes, data modelling concepts and data warehouse architecture
Experience with Azure Data platforms or similar platforms like BigQuery, Snowflake, etc. ...
Good knowledge of database principles, strong proficiency in SQL
Experience with reporting tools (Power BI, …)
Inquisitive, analytical problem-solving mindset
Fluent in Czech, advanced in English


Additional Information

WHY JOIN US?

At Eurowag Group, we value our employees' well-being and professional growth.

EW is diverse, disruptive and still evolving; we choose newcomers not only by skill but also by whether they can be real colleagues through shared values. What's more, you will have an opportunity to influence the direction of our company through your ideas.

Work-Life Balance

5 weeks of holidays

Fresh orange juice every day

Philanthropy project

Title: Data & BI Analyst
Description:
The Company

KIKO MILANO was founded in 1997 in Milan and since then has revolutionized how cosmetics are sold globally. We thrive to offer an incredible variety of products, textures & colours, a multi-sensorial experience in innovative technology yet always at an affordable price. Based in Italy, and truthful to its DNA, KIKO MILANO takes advantage of combining trustworthy quality, creativity and stunning aesthetics







Your role at KIKO MILANO

We are looking for a Data & BI Analyst to join KIKO MILANO’s Transformation team, reporting to the Data Analytics Senior Manager.




Such talent will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable insights, working closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design and develop BI solutions and provide analytical support.

Your expertise will be crucial in helping the company make data-driven decisions, optimize processes, and identify growth opportunities.




In particular, you will:




Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights and support decision-making;
Develop, implement, and maintain BI solutions using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms;
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into technical requirements;
Design and create dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings effectively;
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support strategic initiatives;
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analytics and BI technologies;
Provide training and support to end-users to ensure they can effectively use BI tools and understand insights.







What you will need to succeed

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related role.
Proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, or similar.
Strong SQL skills and experience with data querying and manipulation.
Experience with programming languages such as Python is a plus.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud is a plus.







We would love if you had

Excellent communication and influencing skills with experience of building relationships across an organisation
Strong organisational skills with an ability to re- prioritise as required to meet deadlines
Experience working in a fast-paced environment
Highly collaborative style and willingness and demonstrated ability to work in teams

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Apeiron Insight

Apeiron Insight is a data-driven research & analytics company, providing data products and insights to investment companies. We use predictive modelling to deliver actionable intelligence to the biggest sharks in the tank. Apeiron Insight is growing fast. We are hiring for several roles in multiple disciplines to scale up our operation.

 

Your role with us

As a Data Analyst you are responsible for analyzing Apeiron’s various data streams. You will help the Data Engineering team to spot anomalies in the data processing & provide the Business team with data analyses and actionable insights. You collect and combine data sets from various sources and build and maintain dashboards and reports to provide insights into the processes in our warehouse.




Main responsibilities will include:

Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large amounts of data.
Identifying patterns, trends and deviations in the data and translating them into understandable reports and actionable insights.
Maintaining existing data processes and engineering new (automation) solutions to achieve better and faster reporting and analysis of our various datasets.
Collaborating with the Engineering team to optimize data collection and analysis processes.
Presenting findings and recommendations to internal stakeholders in a clear and concise manner and become the intermediary between the business needs and data solutions.




What are we looking for?

You have a Master’s degree in Finance, Econometrics, Operations Research, Mathematics, Engineering field or other relevant studies.
1-2 years of experience in business analysis, data analysis, market research, or management consulting.
Proficiency with Excel and SQL and Python for analysis of big data.
Experience with data visualization and data analysis libraries, such as PowerBi, Pandas and Numpy.
You are a self-starter who works well in a fast-paced environment.
You are currently living in the Netherlands and can fluently communicate in English (verbally and in writing). Command of the Dutch language is a plus.
You are legally allowed to work in the Netherlands.
You are able to come to our lovely office in Rijswijk.




What we offer?

This is your chance to join a dynamic data company where you’ll be part of a very ambitious and smart team on a mission. You’ll get all the benefits of working for an agile scale-up such as a relaxed work environment, the possibility to work from home part of the time, easy-going colleagues and freedom in your work. Additionally, we offer you:

Competitive salary tailored to your skills & experience,
25 vacation days based on a 40-hour working week
8% holiday payment
Profit Sharing Bonus scheme
Pension & Mobility Allowance
An annual budget of €3.000 to spend on professional or personal development
Hybrid work model: a mix of working from home and in the office
Healthy and delicious buffet breakfast, lunch and a filled refrigerator in the office
Everything you need to work from home: a screen, keyboard and mouse
Fun events with colleagues
A referral reward program: refer a friend for one of our jobs




Sounds like you? Let us know. Please submit your resume and motivation letter.

Title: People Data Analyst
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

We are looking for a People Data Analyst to join our People Analytics Team. As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to further support decision making in the company with people data.

Your primary focus will be on analyzing and interpreting data across the employee lifecycle providing a holistic view from candidacy to alumni. You will work closely with a Senior Analyst, have an opportunity to build People analytics products from scratch and shape the People Analytics function at Vinted. We’re looking for a candidate that has knowledge of analysis tools and the ability to communicate well with a variety of stakeholders.

Reporting to a People Systems & Analytics Lead in the People team you will work within a team whose mandate is to accelerate people analytics at Vinted. You will work with data across various People systems like Workday, Greenhouse, Peakon and others.

In this position, you’ll


Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based culture
Maintain and build dashboards and perform analysis on data spanning across the complete Employee Life Cycle (“From Hire to Retire”)
Assist stakeholders in identifying trends and patterns within People data to provide valuable insights
Contribute to cross-functional projects and initiatives in People team


About You


BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or another related field
At least 2 years of experience in a similar role, specializing in data analysis and storytelling
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker but Tableau and Power Bi are applicable too
You are a Google Sheets master
Strong communication skills with proficiency in English
Knowledge of HR domain or a strong interest in developing skills in HR analytics
Knowledge of SQL is a significant advantage


Nice-to-have:


Familiarity with Workday
Knowledge of a statistical programming language (R, Python, Matlab etc.)


Work perks


30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

We invest in your professional growth! As part of our commitment to continuous learning, we offer an annual learning budget to support your personal and career development through courses, certifications, workshops and more.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 51,900 - € 70,200 gross per year.

This onsite position supports the IT department’s mission to leverage data for enhancing business intelligence capabilities, refining processes, and driving operational efficiencies. This role requires a detail-oriented, analytical thinker with a collaborative spirit, focused on data integration and platform development. The analyst will work closely with IT and other departments to translate business needs into actionable data solutions, aligning insights with Chematek’s strategic objectives.

Participate in AI and ERP Implementation: Assist in the deployment of the company’s AI initiatives and ERP implementation projects, ensuring alignment with business goals and smooth integration.

Report Generation and Data Visualization: Create and maintain reports and dashboards, offering stakeholders clear and actionable insights through data visualization tools.

ERP Experience: Previous experience working with ERP systems is required; familiarity with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central is advantageous.

Microsoft Environment Familiarity: Comfortable working in a Microsoft-centric environment, including experience with Azure, Power BI, and related tools.

Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports.

Experience in Data Management: 1-2 years of experience in data analysis, data management, or business intelligence, ideally in a corporate setting.

Communication and Collaboration: Excellent communication skills to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy and attention to detail in managing and analysing data.

Description:
Job Location

Bucharest

Job Description

Would you like to harness the power of data to drive business results, through breakthrough analytics, business consulting and innovative data capabilities? Are you able to discover the story in all the noise and identify what really matters? Join us in this engaging journey!

The Analytics & Insights organization creates a point of difference for P&G. We directly influence business strategy, via deep consumer, retailer and market understanding, spanning from human insights to data science. We innovate every single day the way business is done, through advanced mathematical models, providing optimization algorithms and uncovering unexpected insights.

This role is within Analytics (IT). You will be the go-to-person on data analysis and big data application, with your deep understanding of and passion for data analysis and data science techniques, striking the tangent between consumer insights and advanced analytics to solve tough business problems as a strategic consultant to P&G leadership.

Your Responsibilities


Deliver insights by using advanced analytic techniques, mining extremely large data sets and applying best in class algorithms developed in partnership with other Data Scientists/ Analysts
Analyze Market & Share performance of our brands, to identify trends and root-causes
Forecast key growth opportunities and competitive threats to design new market strategies
Grow the organizations’ knowledge with analytic capabilities.


Job Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master's degree in: Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Math, Statistics, Analytics etc.
Passionate about discovering new things, analyzing data or programming to deliver strong insights and strategic recommendations against defined business objectives
Solid written, visual, and verbal communication skills
Excellent command of English
Strong interpersonal skills, great priority-setting, self-motivated, collaborative, ‘can-do’ attitude
Experience with data science programming languages and/or business analytics tools (SQL/R/Python/Power BI) is required, while previous knowledge of Big Data ecosystem (Hadoop, Azure) would be considered an asset.


Becoming part of P&G, you will benefit of


Competitive salary package, annual bonus, and vacation bonus
Private medical insurance & life insurance & 24 Hours Accident Insurance
Stock Ownership Plan - You have the opportunity to buy P&G shares quoted on the New York Stock Exchange to participate in the profits of the Company and the company will match part of the investments
Flexible working schedule & Hybrid Work from Home/Work from Office option
Meal allowance and access to our private canteen
Sports Program – will allow you to reimburse sport activities
Dental & Glasses Plan - will allow you to reimburse dental and ophthalmological care
Access to a variety of learning and development platforms
Employee Assistance Program – confidential expert guidance and specialist support on any work, wellbeing, emotional, financial, physical or family issue.
