Description:
Freelance Service Data Analyst (B2B Contract, Fully Remote)

Start Date: 15th November | Location: Romania




We are seeking an experienced Service Data Analyst to join our team on a freelance, B2B contract basis. This fully remote position, available to candidates based in Romania, will start on November 15. As a Service Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in developing analysis models, creating dashboards, and providing ad-hoc analytical support to help guide business decisions. This role involves working closely with architects and business analysts to harness the power of data for impactful insights and strategic guidance.




Objectives

Analysis Model Development: Build data models based on specific business needs and in alignment with architects and business analysts.
Data Ingestion: Ingest and manage data in the Datalake, ensuring seamless access for analytical needs.
Dashboard & Reporting Creation: Create and support the development of dashboards and reports to provide visibility into key business metrics.
Ad-hoc Analysis: Conduct on-demand analyses for specific or exploratory needs using SQL, Spotfire, and other tools.




Key Responsibilities

Collaborative Analysis: Partner with architects and analysts to evaluate data availability and applicability within operational systems and the Datalake.
Data Integration: Manage and integrate data into the Datalake, ensuring a seamless process that meets analysis and reporting requirements.
Dashboard Design: Design and build dashboards that convey insights effectively and can be scaled or modified based on evolving business needs.
Agile Process Participation: Engage in Agile practices to support continuous development and improvement of data analysis processes.




Skills & Experience Required

Experience: Minimum of 3 years as a data analyst, with expertise in SQL, database management, and dashboard tools like Spotfire.
Agile Methodology: Experience working within Agile frameworks, with familiarity in using Jira and Confluence.
Data Tools: Proficiency in Hue, Zeenea, BigQuery, Data Studio, and Datalake management, along with MS Excel/VBA.
Advantageous Skills: Knowledge of Java/Scala and/or Spark for data processing.
Languages: Intermediate level of English; French is a plus for collaboration.

Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Job Description

As the new Data Analyst, you will be responsible for leading key projects, identifying opportunities and developing roadmaps for data analytics. You will oversee the design, build, test and deployment of key solutions and also be managing internal SME’s and BTS processes while interacting with different teams on both a national and global level. This is a new role in the business for someone with prior experience and the ability to implement & design high quality business intelligence and advance analytics solutions aligning with business strategies.

Key responsibilities:


Ensure data quality, accuracy and auditability
Provide training and support to an SME Network on Power BI and analytics
Define support processes for delivered projects
Develop high standard solutions documentation and define support processes
As the solution matures, implement predictive systems to enhance decision making and performance
Champion the Power BI Centre of Excellence, providing mentorship and direction to team members within ADM and SME’s
Develop and support learning solutions to grow the expertise of the centre of excellence and the broader CFS Community of Practice
Lead the business intelligence and data analytics development roadmap within the Advanced Digital Manufacturing team


Qualifications

What you will need:


Relevant 3rd level qualification in Engineering, Analytics or Computer Science
3+ years prior experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role
Experience in digital technology/ process implementation’s, visualisation tools and robotic process automation
Ability to liaise with multiple high functional teams
Proven track record of driving projects and programs to successful completion in matrix organisations
Proficient in OLTP/ OLAP data structures, Tableau, Power BI OR Power platform capabilities, SQL Query, HIVE QL and statistical methods
Basic knowledge of Python or R
